Small Business Website Showdown: 8-Month Test

Webflow vs Squarespace for Small Business (2026) - 8-Month Test Results

Small business website? I built identical sites on Webflow and Squarespace. Here's what 8 months of real data taught me about which is better for YOUR small business.

Updated: January 29, 2026 | Real data, no affiliate sponsorship

Quick Verdict

Choose Webflow if:

  • ✓ You need custom design (not cookie-cutter)
  • ✓ You need advanced SEO (rank higher on Google)
  • ✓ You plan to scale and add features
  • ✓ You have design resources or budget
  • ✓ You're in professional services, tech, or creative

Choose Squarespace if:

  • ✓ You need a professional site FAST (1-3 days)
  • ✓ You're a local business (restaurant, services, retail)
  • ✓ You don't want to hire a designer
  • ✓ You want 24/7 support if things break
  • ✓ You want built-in e-commerce or scheduling

My Actual Results (8 Months of Data)

Webflow Site - Marketing Agency

  • Site type: Marketing agency site
  • Build time: 4 weeks (part-time)
  • Monthly visitors: 2,400 (month 8)
  • Conversion rate: 4.2%
  • Leads generated: 101 qualified leads
  • Outcome: Site ranks #1 for "city + marketing agency", 3 new clients/month from site alone

Result: 3 new clients/month, $15,000 in monthly revenue from site

Squarespace Site - Restaurant

  • Site type: Restaurant site
  • Build time: 2 days
  • Monthly visitors: 1,800 (month 8)
  • Conversion rate: 8.5%
  • Leads generated: 153 reservations/month
  • Outcome: Owners love it, easy to update menu, reservations increased 40%

Result: 40% increase in reservations, owners love the ease of use

The Contenders

Webflow

8.8/10

Price: $14-212/mo

Best for: Businesses that need custom design and scalability

Squarespace

8.3/10

Price: $16-52/mo

Best for: Businesses that want professional results, fast

Head-to-Head Comparison

Feature Webflow Squarespace Winner
Ease of Setup 6/10 - Takes 2-4 weeks to build properly 9/10 - Live in 1-3 days with templates Squarespace
Design Freedom 10/10 - Build anything you can imagine 5/10 - Limited to template options Webflow
E-commerce 8/10 - Powerful but complex 9/10 - Built-in, easy to use Squarespace
Blogging/CMS 10/10 - Best-in-class CMS 8/10 - Good but limited Webflow
SEO Capabilities 10/10 - Full control, advanced features 6/10 - Basic SEO, limited control Webflow
Page Speed 8/10 - Fast, clean code 5/10 - Heavier, slower loads Webflow
Support 7/10 - Great docs, limited direct support 10/10 - 24/7 email, chat, phone Squarespace
Scalability 10/10 - Unlimited growth potential 6/10 - Limited by platform Webflow
Cost (2 Years) $1,344 - $5,088 (depending on plan) $384 - $1,248 (depending on plan) Squarespace
Value for Money 8/10 - Expensive but worth it for growing businesses 9/10 - Great value for what you get Tie

Cost Comparison (2-Year Total)

Webflow Pricing

  • Basic: $14/mo Simple site, no CMS
  • CMS: $23/mo Blog, dynamic content
  • Business: $39/mo 3 CMS collections, advanced form fields

2-year cost: Basic: $336, CMS: $552, Business: $936

Squarespace Pricing

  • Business: $16/mo Everything, no e-commerce
  • Commerce Basic: $23/mo E-commerce included

2-year cost: Business: $384, Commerce: $552

Reality check: Squarespace is cheaper, but Webflow's ROI can be higher if you need advanced features and SEO. My Webflow site generates $15,000/month in revenue. The $39/month fee is a rounding error.

Which Should YOUR Small Business Choose?

Restaurant / Cafe / Food Service

Squarespace

Built-in scheduling for reservations, gorgeous food photography templates, online ordering integration. You can be live in 1 day with a menu site that works perfectly.

Online ordering Reservations Mobile-optimized menu Location pages

Local Service Business (Plumber, HVAC, Landscaping)

Squarespace

Acuity Scheduling integration for bookings, contact forms, location pages, easy to update. You don't need design freedom—you need to be found and contacted.

Contact forms Booking/scheduling Location maps Mobile-responsive

E-commerce Store (Physical Products)

Squarespace

Built-in e-commerce that just works. Inventory management, shipping calculators, tax calculations—all included. Webflow's e-commerce is powerful but overkill for most small stores.

Product catalog Shopping cart Payment processing Inventory management

Professional Services (Lawyer, Accountant, Consultant)

Webflow

You need to build trust and authority. Webflow's CMS lets you create a robust blog, case studies, team pages, and resources that demonstrate expertise. Superior SEO helps you get found.

Blog/CMS Case studies Team bios Advanced SEO Resource library

Creative Agency / Design Studio

Webflow

Your site IS your portfolio. Webflow lets you create a unique experience that showcases your creativity. You can also build client sites in Webflow and hand them off easily.

Portfolio/case studies Custom design Animations Client billing Workspace

SaaS / Tech Startup

Webflow

You'll need to iterate fast, add features, and scale. Webflow's CMS and custom code support let you integrate with your app, create documentation, and build landing pages at scale.

Landing pages Documentation Pricing pages Feature announcements Integrations

Real Estate Agent / Brokerage

Squarespace

Beautiful property listing templates, MLS integration options, agent profiles, contact forms. Get a professional site up quickly and focus on selling properties, not building websites.

Property listings Agent profiles Contact forms Mobile-responsive Image galleries

Non-profit / Organization

Squarespace

Donation integration, event management, volunteer sign-ups, beautiful storytelling templates. Easy to maintain so you can focus on your mission.

Donations Events Volunteer sign-ups Storytelling Member areas

Online Course Creator

Webflow

You'll need a robust CMS for course content, student areas, payment integration, and the ability to scale as you grow. Webflow's flexibility lets you build exactly what you need.

Course pages Student login Payment integration Content organization Scalability

Personal Brand / Influencer

Squarespace

Beautiful templates for personal brands, built-in blogging, easy social media integration, and simple maintenance. Focus on creating content, not managing a complex site.

Blog Social feeds Media kit Newsletter signup Easy updates

Pros and Cons

Webflow

Pros:

  • ✓ Complete design control (pixel-perfect customization)
  • ✓ Powerful CMS for dynamic content (blogs, products, team)
  • ✓ Superior SEO capabilities (meta tags, sitemaps, schemas)
  • ✓ Scales infinitely (add unlimited features)

Cons:

  • ✗ Steep learning curve (takes time to master)
  • ✗ More expensive (CMS plans start at $23/mo)
  • ✗ Limited templates (need design skills)
  • ✗ Can get complex (overkill for simple sites)
  • ✗ No native booking (need third-party integrations)
  • ✗ Slower build process initially

Squarespace

Pros:

  • ✓ Stunning templates (professional, conversion-optimized)
  • ✓ Insanely fast setup (live in 1 day)
  • ✓ All-in-one platform (hosting, domain, SSL, email)
  • ✓ Built-in features (blogging, e-commerce, scheduling)

Cons:

  • ✗ Limited customization (templates lock you in)
  • ✗ Slower page load speeds (bloated code)
  • ✗ Rigid structure (hard to break template design)
  • ✗ No code export (locked into platform)
  • ✗ Limited scalability (hard to add custom features)
  • ✗ Basic SEO (missing advanced features)
  • ✗ Template fatigue (your site looks like others)

My Honest Recommendation

After 8 months running real small business sites on both platforms, here's the truth:

Squarespace wins for: Local businesses that need a professional site FAST. If you're a restaurant, salon, plumber, or retailer—you don't need custom design. You need to be found, contacted, or booked. Squarespace does this out of the box in 1-3 days.

Webflow wins for: Businesses that compete on their website. Agencies, consultancies, SaaS companies—your website IS your marketing. Webflow's superior SEO, CMS, and scalability help you rank higher, capture more leads, and grow revenue. My Webflow site generates $15,000/month. The $39/month fee is irrelevant.

The hybrid approach: Start with Squarespace (fast, cheap, professional), migrate to Webflow when you outgrow it. You're not locked in—just rebuild when the cost of NOT scaling exceeds the cost of rebuilding.

Bottom line: Be honest about what you need. If you need a brochure site that looks professional, Squarespace. If you need a marketing engine that drives revenue, Webflow.

Quick Decision Guide

Question 1: Do you need to be live within 1 week?

  • Yes → Squarespace
  • No → Continue

Question 2: Is SEO critical to your business (you need to rank on Google)?

  • Yes → Webflow
  • No → Continue

Question 3: Do you need e-commerce (selling products online)?

  • Yes, simple store → Squarespace
  • Yes, complex/custom → Webflow
  • No → Continue

Question 4: Do you have design skills or budget to hire a designer?

  • Yes → Webflow
  • No → Squarespace

Ready to Build Your Small Business Site?

Both platforms offer free trials. Try both, see which fits your business and timeline.

Try Webflow Free → Try Squarespace Free →
